<a id="InputEvent"></a>

# InputEvent

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [InputEventAction](InputEventAction.md), [InputEventFromWindow](InputEventFromWindow.md), [InputEventJoypadButton](InputEventJoypadButton.md), [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md), [InputEventMIDI](InputEventMIDI.md), [InputEventShortcut](InputEventShortcut.md)

Abstract base class for input events.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Abstract base class of all types of input events. See [Node._input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__input).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Using InputEvent](../tutorials/inputs/inputevent.md)

- [Viewport and canvas transforms](../tutorials/2d/2d_transforms.md)

- [2D Dodge The Creeps Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2712)

- [3D Voxel Demo](https://godotengine.org/asset-library/asset/2755)

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constants

<a id="InputEvent_constant_DEVICE_ID_EMULATION"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**DEVICE_ID_EMULATION** = `-1` [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_constant_DEVICE_ID_EMULATION)

Device ID used for emulated mouse input from a touchscreen, or for emulated touch input from a mouse. This can be used to distinguish emulated mouse input from physical mouse input, or emulated touch input from physical touch input.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="InputEvent_property_device"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **device** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_property_device)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_device**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_device**\ (\ )

The event's device ID.

\ **Note:** [device](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_property_device) can be negative for special use cases that don't refer to devices physically present on the system. See [DEVICE_ID_EMULATION](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_constant_DEVICE_ID_EMULATION).

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="InputEvent_method_accumulate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **accumulate**\ (\ with_event\: [InputEvent](InputEvent.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_accumulate)

Returns ``true`` if the given input event and this input event can be added together (only for events of type [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md)).

The given input event's position, global position and speed will be copied. The resulting ``relative`` is a sum of both events. Both events' modifiers have to be identical.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_as_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **as_text**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_as_text)

Returns a [String](String.md) representation of the event.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_get_action_strength"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_action_strength**\ (\ action\: [StringName](StringName.md), exact_match\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_get_action_strength)

Returns a value between 0.0 and 1.0 depending on the given actions' state. Useful for getting the value of events of type [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md).

If `exact_match` is ``false``, it ignores additional input modifiers for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) and [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) events, and the direction for [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md) events.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_action"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_action**\ (\ action\: [StringName](StringName.md), exact_match\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_action)

Returns ``true`` if this input event matches a pre-defined action of any type.

If `exact_match` is ``false``, it ignores additional input modifiers for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) and [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) events, and the direction for [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md) events.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_action_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_action_pressed**\ (\ action\: [StringName](StringName.md), allow_echo\: [bool](bool.md) = false, exact_match\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_action_pressed)

Returns ``true`` if the given action matches this event and is being pressed (and is not an echo event for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) events, unless `allow_echo` is ``true``). Not relevant for events of type [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md) or [InputEventScreenDrag](InputEventScreenDrag.md).

If `exact_match` is ``false``, it ignores additional input modifiers for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) and [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) events, and the direction for [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md) events.

\ **Note:** Due to keyboard ghosting, [is_action_pressed()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_action_pressed) may return ``false`` even if one of the action's keys is pressed. See [Input examples](../tutorials/inputs/input_examples.md#keyboard-events) in the documentation for more information.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_action_released"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_action_released**\ (\ action\: [StringName](StringName.md), exact_match\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_action_released)

Returns ``true`` if the given action matches this event and is released (i.e. not pressed). Not relevant for events of type [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md) or [InputEventScreenDrag](InputEventScreenDrag.md).

If `exact_match` is ``false``, it ignores additional input modifiers for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) and [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) events, and the direction for [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md) events.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_action_type"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_action_type**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_action_type)

Returns ``true`` if this input event's type is one that can be assigned to an input action: [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md), [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md), [InputEventJoypadButton](InputEventJoypadButton.md), [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md), [InputEventAction](InputEventAction.md). Returns ``false`` for all other input event types.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_canceled"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_canceled**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_canceled)

Returns ``true`` if this input event has been canceled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_echo"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_echo**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_echo)

Returns ``true`` if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md)). An echo event is a repeated key event sent when the user is holding down the key. Any other event type returns ``false``.

\ **Note:** The rate at which echo events are sent is typically around 20 events per second (after holding down the key for roughly half a second). However, the key repeat delay/speed can be changed by the user or disabled entirely in the operating system settings. To ensure your project works correctly on all configurations, do not assume the user has a specific key repeat configuration in your project's behavior.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_match"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_match**\ (\ event\: [InputEvent](InputEvent.md), exact_match\: [bool](bool.md) = true\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_match)

Returns ``true`` if the specified `event` matches this event. Only valid for action events, which include key ([InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md)), button ([InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) or [InputEventJoypadButton](InputEventJoypadButton.md)), axis [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md), and action ([InputEventAction](InputEventAction.md)) events.

If `exact_match` is ``false``, the check ignores additional input modifiers for [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md) and [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md) events, and the direction for [InputEventJoypadMotion](InputEventJoypadMotion.md) events.

\ **Note:** This method only considers the event configuration (such as the keyboard key or the joypad axis), not state information like [is_pressed()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_pressed), [is_released()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_released), [is_echo()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_echo), or [is_canceled()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_canceled).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_pressed"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_pressed**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_pressed)

Returns ``true`` if this input event is pressed. Not relevant for events of type [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md) or [InputEventScreenDrag](InputEventScreenDrag.md).

\ **Note:** Due to keyboard ghosting, [is_pressed()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_pressed) may return ``false`` even if one of the action's keys is pressed. See [Input examples](../tutorials/inputs/input_examples.md#keyboard-events) in the documentation for more information.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_is_released"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_released**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_is_released)

Returns ``true`` if this input event is released. Not relevant for events of type [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md) or [InputEventScreenDrag](InputEventScreenDrag.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InputEvent_method_xformed_by"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[InputEvent](InputEvent.md) **xformed_by**\ (\ xform\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md), local_ofs\: [Vector2](Vector2.md) = Vector2(0, 0)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InputEvent_method_xformed_by)

Returns a copy of the given input event which has been offset by `local_ofs` and transformed by `xform`. Relevant for events of type [InputEventMouseButton](InputEventMouseButton.md), [InputEventMouseMotion](InputEventMouseMotion.md), [InputEventScreenTouch](InputEventScreenTouch.md), [InputEventScreenDrag](InputEventScreenDrag.md), [InputEventMagnifyGesture](InputEventMagnifyGesture.md) and [InputEventPanGesture](InputEventPanGesture.md).
